duties_responsibilities.duty: Provide a central point of communication for customers requiring assistance with machinery, parts, service, or training.
Follow up on sales leads and provide timely and concise answers based on technical knowledge.
Upsell remote and onsite services for customers to expand their view of us as the complete solutions provider.
Request and track information, samples, budgets, project timing, etc., from customers to enable the creation of quotes.
Coordinate offsite customer installation activities and Site Acceptance Tests (SAT) to ensure quality and timeliness.
Create comprehensive documentation post installation and support trade shows via planning, machine delivery logistics, booth coverage, and administrative tasks.
Assist sales and marketing teams with routine emails, scheduling, and administrative activities.
Perform CRM administrative work such as data management, list uploading, list cleansing, dashboard creation, and reports.
Assist with the preparation of sales and marketing presentations and track spare parts orders.

education_certification.credential: Minimum two years’ experience in a technology company administrative role.
Experience with HubSpot or other CRM software programs preferred.
Ability to read and comprehend component and assembly technical drawings is a plus.
Proficient in using Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint.
Bachelor's degree in a related field (preferred)
